CHAT.comment: Hesitation phenomena have not been accurately transcribed in this data.

u.a: MOT , CHI , INV enter the room . INV explains Warm-up task to MOT . INV leaves the room
INV and friend of MOT leave the room
CHI looks at the toys on the floor
CHI opens the book lying on the floor
MOT holds the book in front of CHI
MOT turns to the beginning of the book
CHI points to the picture in the book
MOT points to picture and looks at CHI
CHI looks up at the picture on the wall
MOT looks at the picture on the wall
CHI moves close to the book
CHI looks at the picture in the book
CHI points to a picture in the book
CHI takes the book and starts to walk away
CHI looks at the back cover of the book
CHI holds out the book for MOT
MOT takes the book from CHI
CHI squats down and picks up the jack+in+the+box
CHI stands up holding the jack+in+the+box
MOT lifts up the handle of the jack+in+the+box for CHI to turn
CHI fiddles with the handle of the jack+in+the+box
MOT puts her hand over CHI hand and turns the handle
MOT and CHI turn the handle of the jack+in+the+box together
CHI tries to push the jack back down
instead of turning the handle the CHI jerks the jack+in+the+box up and down
MOT turns the jack+in+the+box handle hand over hand with CHI
as CHI grows impatient she begins to stomp her feet
CHI holds the jack by his arms
CHI pushes the jack back into the box
CHI prepares to turn the handle
MOT puts the jack+in+the+box on the floor
MOT points to the lid of the jack+in+the+box
CHI tries to turn the jack+in+the+box but has some difficulty

INV enters the room to explain Small Scale Activity to MOT then leaves the room while Small Scale activity takes place . INV re-enters at 11:39:09 and explains the Forbidden Object task to MOT and has her sit next to CHI at the table . INV gives CHI the slinky toy to hold
INV takes the Forbidden Object out of the drawer
CHI looks at the Forbidden Object
INV sets the Forbidden Object on the table
CHI gives MOT the slinky toy
MOT points to the Forbidden Object
CHI stretches out her hand to touch the object
CHI drops the slinky toy and tries to touch the object
MOT picks up the slinky toy
MOT gives CHI the slinky toy
CHI takes the toy and then tries to touch the object
INV tells MOT about Parent Child Interaction Boxes . INV picks up the toys from Small Scale Activity
MOT takes the box down from the table
CHI stretches out her arms for the ball
MOT takes out the ball and gives it to CHI
CHI holds the ball and makes bouncing movements
CHI gives MOT the ball to hold
MOT nods to the other side of the room with her head
CHI tries to take the ball from MOT
CHI tries to take the ball back
CHI turns her back to MOT
CHI raises her arms into the air
CHI lifts her arms either too high or too low
CHI holds her arms in the right position
MOT throws the ball to CHI
CHI throws the ball to MOT
CHI runs after the ball and then picks up the ball
CHI runs over to the stool
MOT holds the ball ready to face CHI
CHI puts her hands on her head
CHI slams her hands down on the ball that MOT holds and then lets go
CHI turns her back to MOT
MOT pokes CHI in the back
MOT throws the ball to CHI
CHI misses the ball and the ball rolls behind the table
CHI goes over to the table with the boxes
MOT points to the ball on the floor
<bef> CHI picks up the ball . CHI gives MOT the ball
CHI tries to touch the boxes on the table
MOT puts the ball into the box
MOT holds the cloth in front of CHI
MOT holds the towel out for CHI
MOT holds towel over her face and then peeks over it
MOT holds the towel out for CHI
MOT holds the towel out to CHI
CHI pays no attention to MOT and does not look at the towel
CHI runs over to the table with the boxes
<bef> CHI tries to reach the boxes on the table
MOT puts the cloth in the box
MOT takes the paper out of the box
MOT shows CHI the paper and crayon
CHI takes the crayon from MOT
MOT puts the paper on the table
CHI draws on the paper and then on the table
CHI holds up her drawing to MOT
CHI gives the crayon and paper to MOT
End of PCI - Crayons and Paper
MOT takes the book out of the box
MOT gives the CHI the book
CHI looks at the cover of the book
MOT points to the picture in the book
CHI begins to move around restlessly
MOT holds the book open in front of CHI
CHI turns the page of the book
a noise is heard in the hall
MOT leans into CHI to hear better
MOT points to the same picture
MOT points to the next picture
